titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Old Fashioned Revival Hour Collection ARS.0026
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Nancy Lorimer

publicationstmt.p: The Board of Trustees of Stanford University. All rights reserved.

profiledesc.descrules: Prepared using Describing Archives: a Content Standard

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Old Fashioned Revival Hour Collection
did.abstract: Evangelical sermons, prayers, and hymnal recordings on Compact Disc, originally broadcast from 1937 to 1968 on the radio program Old Fashioned Revival Hour.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research; material must be requested at least two business days in advance of intended use. Contact the Archive for assistance.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with repository. Publication and reproduction rights reside with the creators or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the Head Librarian of the Archive of Recorded Sound.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Old Fashioned Revival Hour Collection, ARS-0026. Courtesy of the Stanford Archive of Recorded Sound, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, CA.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Charles Fuller (1887-1968) was a Baptist minister and radio evangelist. He gained renown as the radio host and speaker of The Old Fashioned Revival Hour, a weekly Sunday broadcast that aired from 1937 to 1968. The first nationwide broadcast occurred on October 3, 1937, on the Mutual Broadcasting System. Beginning in 1951, the program was carried on the ABC Radio Network, heard on more than 650 radio stations. The Old Fashioned Revival Hour broadcast was originally recorded in a Hollywood studio. In 1941, it was moved to the old Municipal Auditorium in Long Beach, California. From 1941 through 1958, audiences attended services that were broadcast live on the radio from the Long Beach Municipal Auditorium. After January 12, 1958, the program was again produced in a studio, until it ended in 1968. The broadcasts were also noted for the music, featuring the Old Fashioned Revival Hour Choir and quartet, accompanied by organist George Broadbent and pianist Rudy Atwood. Several popular recordings were made by the choir in the 1940s and 1950s. Re-broadcasts of the Old Fashioned Revival Hour are now streamed weekly on the internet.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of Compact Disc copies of radio broadcasts of the Old Fashioned Revival Hour, a program of hymns, prayers, and sermons led by Charles E. Fuller and his wife, plus CDs and cassettes of music. The programs were originally broadcast from approximately 1937 until 1968 and have been re-broadcast on several radio stations since 2002. The collection includes original programs from the 1950s and rebroadcasts from 2002 to the present. More programs will be added as they become available. The music CDs and cassettes were were produced on the campus of Fuller Theological Seminary and were published between 1999 and 2004.

odd.head: Broadcast information
odd.p: The radio program originally broadcast from 1937 to 1968. Known original broadcast dates of items in this collection are from Dec. 19, 1954 to Jul. 10, 1955. Rebroadcast from Oct. 7, 2007 to the present.

did.unittitle: Radio programs
Original broadcasts
Program no. 162, Seven marvels of mercy

bioghist.head: Historical note
bioghist.p: "Last broadcast from Municipal Auditorium in Long Beach, CA."

did.unittitle: Program no. 917

scopecontent.head: Contents
scopecontent.p: If your heart keeps right -- He is so precious to me -- Heavenly sunshine -- Medley: He is altogether lovely to me/I've a longing in my heart/Rock of ages hide thou me/Blessed be the name of Jesus/Every moment, every hour/My Lord knows the way throught the wilderness -- Climbin' up the mountain -- Letters -- The love of God -- No not one -- Prayer/invitation -- Send the light -- Bringing in the sheaves -- Nothing between -- Scripture text: Genesis 6 -- Message: The days of Noah -- Invitation hymn: Almost persuaded.

Gospel music recordings
Cassette tape album no. 7, Old Fashioned Revival Hour Quartet

scopecontent.head: Contents
scopecontent.p: In tenderness he sought me -- Nearer, still nearer -- Somebody's knocking at your door -- My heavenly home -- Jesus, rose of Sharon -- Seeking the lost -- There'll be no more tears in Paradise -- The way of the cross leads home -- Love found a way -- My Lord's gonna move this wicked race -- Deeper yet, deeper yet -- Living for Jesus -- More like the master, my heavenly Father watches over me -- Let Him have his way with thee -- Bring them in -- Saved, saved -- Sun of my soul -- Near to the heart of God -- The far away land -- Tell me the story of Jesus -- We'll meet each other there -- Glorious things of Thee are spoken -- Take the name of Jesus -- Heavenly sunshine -- His yoke is easy ,his burden is light -- What a friend.

scopecontent.head: Contents
scopecontent.p: Brethern we have met to worship -- I'll be a friend to Jesus -- He lifted me -- On Jordan's strand -- We'll never say good-bye -- Hold Thou my hand -- To the work -- Jesus the very thought of thee -- Sound the battle cry -- Jesus I my cross have taken -- I'm happy in my savior, he's the one -- Tell me the old, old story -- The banner of the cross -- Victory through grace -- I am coming nearer -- I remember Calvary -- The home over there -- I shall know him -- Lord I want to be a Christian -- Come to the savior -- Jesus means everything to me -- Dare to stand like Joshua -- Majestic sweetness sits enthroned -- Meet me there -- When is see my savior -- Jesus is tenderly calling.

scopecontent.head: Contents
scopecontent.p: Start your life anew with Jesus : medley -- He put a song in my heart -- All that I need is Jesus -- Eternal Father, strong to save -- Fire song -- Anywhere with Jesus -- Precious Lord, take my hand -- Brighten the corner -- Tell me the story of Jesus -- He is so precious to me -- Shelter in the time of storm -- Dear Lord and Father of mankind -- Beyond the sunset -- Good night and good morning -- What if it where today.

did.unittitle: How great Thou art

scopecontent.head: Contents
scopecontent.p: How great Thou art -- Now I belong to Jesus -- Are you ready? -- I need Thee every hour -- When I see my savior -- I will arise and go to Jesus -- Redwoods -- There's glory in my soul -- My heavenly Father watches over me -- He is mine -- Will the circle be unbroken -- Look away to heaven -- Near to the heart of God -- I know my redeemer lives -- They are nailed to the cross -- We worship and adore Thee.

did.unittitle: Rudy Atwood and the Ralph Carmichael String Quartet

scopecontent.head: Contents
scopecontent.p: Come thou font -- Yield not to temptation -- Jesus I my cross have taken -- Beneat the cross of Jesus -- Free as a bird -- Jesus I come -- Like a river glorious -- He the pearly gates will open -- God leads his dear children along -- O Jesus I have promised -- I gave my life for Thee -- My faith looks up to Thee -- Blessed assurance -- No not one -- Day by day -- Near the cross -- Precious hiding place -- No night there -- His eye is on the the sparrow -- Come ye disconsolate -- Jesus I am resting -- God will take care of you -- Nearer my God to thee -- Blessed quietness.
